title: geobounds: Accessing Global Administrative Boundary Data in R
text: geobounds package provides straightforward interface downloading working global political administrative boundary data geoBoundaries project (Runfola et al. 2020). datasets openly licensed (CC 4.0) cover countries worldwide across multiple administrative levels. geobounds, can easily fetch boundary geometries sf objects, explore metadata, cache datasets locally, seamlessly integrate boundaries spatial workflows.

title: geobounds: Accessing Global Administrative Boundary Data in R
text: geoBoundaries database undergoes rigorous quality assurance process, including manual review hand-digitization physical maps necessary. primary goal provide highest possible level spatial accuracy scientific academic applications. precision comes cost: files can quite large may take longer download. visualization general mapping purposes, recommend using simplified datasets available setting simplified = TRUE. Comparison full vs. simplified map.
code: library(geobounds) library(ggplot2) library(dplyr)  # Different resolutions norway <- gb_get_adm0("NOR") %>%   mutate(res = "Full resolution") print(object.size(norway), units = "Mb") #> 26.5 Mb  norway_simp <- gb_get_adm0(country = "NOR", simplified = TRUE) %>%   mutate(res = "Simplified") print(object.size(norway_simp), units = "Mb") #> 1.5 Mb  norway_all <- bind_rows(norway, norway_simp)  # Plot ggplot2 ggplot(norway_all) +   geom_sf(fill = "#BA0C2F", color = "#00205B") +   facet_wrap(vars(res)) +   theme_minimal() +   labs(caption = "Source: www.geoboundaries.org")

title: geobounds: Accessing Global Administrative Boundary Data in R
text: geoBoundaries API provides individual country files, whose aim represent every nation “represent ”, special identification disputed areas. download data implemented gb_get() gb_get_adm family functions. guaranteed borders align perfectly gaps countries. Additionally, files include special identification disputed areas. Map showing overlapping disputed area: Kashmir. Note individual data files governed license licenses identified within metadata respective boundary.
code: india_pak <- gb_get_adm0(c("India", "Pakistan"))  # Disputed area: Kashmir ggplot(india_pak) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = shapeName), alpha = 0.5) +   scale_fill_manual(values = c("#FF671F", "#00401A")) +   labs(     fill = "Country",     title = "Map of India & Pakistan",     subtitle = "Note overlapping in Kashmir region",     caption = "Source: www.geoboundaries.org"   ) gb_get_meta(c("India", "Pakistan"), adm_lvl = "ADM0") %>%   select(boundaryName, boundaryLicense, boundarySource) #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   boundaryName boundaryLicense                                    boundarySource #>   <chr>        <chr>                                              <chr>          #> 1 India        CC0 1.0 Universal (CC0 1.0) Public Domain Dedicat… geoBoundaries… #> 2 Pakistan     Open Data Commons Open Database License 1.0        OpenStreetMap…

title: geobounds: Accessing Global Administrative Boundary Data in R
text: prefer data explicitly includes disputed areas, please use gb_get_cgaz(). function downloads global composite datasets administrative boundaries, also known CGAZ (Comprehensive Global Administrative Zones). three important distinctions CGAZ individual country downloads: Extensive simplification performed ensure file sizes small enough used traditional desktop software. Disputed areas removed replaced polygons following US Department State definitions. Gaps borders filled. Map showing overlapping Kashmir, provided CGAZ.
code: cgaz_india_pak <- gb_get_cgaz(c("India", "Pakistan"))  ggplot(cgaz_india_pak) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = shapeName), alpha = 0.5) +   scale_fill_manual(values = c("#FF671F", "#00401A")) +   labs(     fill = "Country",     title = "Map of India & Pakistan",     subtitle = "CGAZ does not overlap",     caption = "Source: www.geoboundaries.org"   )

title: geobounds: Accessing Global Administrative Boundary Data in R
text: package provides built-mechanism cache files locally repeated downloads country/level use cached version. example: Specific cache directories function call can set using cache_dir argument function.
code: # Current folder current <- gb_detect_cache_dir() #> ℹ 'C:\Users\RUNNER~1\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpyQmP6J'  current #> [1] "C:\\Users\\RUNNER~1\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\RtmpyQmP6J"  # Change to new newdir <- file.path(tempdir(), "/geoboundvignette") gb_set_cache_dir(newdir) #> ✔ geobounds cache dir is 'C:\Users\RUNNER~1\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpyQmP6J//geoboundvignette'. #> ℹ To install your `cache_dir` path for use in future sessions run this function with `install = TRUE`.  # Download example <- gb_get_adm0("Vatican City", quiet = FALSE) #> ℹ Downloading file from <https://github.com/wmgeolab/geoBoundaries/raw/9469f09/releaseData/gbOpen/VAT/ADM0/geoBoundaries-VAT-ADM0-all.zip> #> → Cache dir is 'C:\Users\RUNNER~1\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpyQmP6J//geoboundvignette/gbOpen'  # Restore cache dir gb_set_cache_dir(current) #> ✔ geobounds cache dir is 'C:\Users\RUNNER~1\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpyQmP6J'. #> ℹ To install your `cache_dir` path for use in future sessions run this function with `install = TRUE`.  current == gb_detect_cache_dir() #> ℹ 'C:\Users\RUNNER~1\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpyQmP6J' #> [1] TRUE

title: geobounds: Accessing Global Administrative Boundary Data in R
text: boundaries returned sf objects, can easily use combination spatial data: Clip raster data administrative units Compute zonal statistics Create choropleth maps Perform spatial joins survey tabular data example create choropleth map using meta data individual files boundaries data CGAZ: World Bank Income Group: Latin America Caribbean
code: # Metadata  latam_meta <- gb_get_meta(adm_lvl = "ADM0") %>%   select(boundaryISO, boundaryName, Continent, worldBankIncomeGroup) %>%   filter(Continent == "Latin America and the Caribbean") %>%   glimpse() #> Rows: 47 #> Columns: 4 #> $ boundaryISO          <chr> "ABW", "AIA", "ARG", "ATG", "BES", "BHS", "BLM", … #> $ boundaryName         <chr> "Aruba", "Anguilla", "Argentina", "Antigua and Ba… #> $ Continent            <chr> "Latin America and the Caribbean", "Latin America… #> $ worldBankIncomeGroup <chr> "High-income Countries", "No income group availab…  # Adjust factors latam_meta$income_factor <- factor(latam_meta$worldBankIncomeGroup,   levels = c(     "High-income Countries",     "Upper-middle-income Countries",     "Lower-middle-income Countries",     "Low-income Countries"   ) )  # Get the shapes from CGAZ latam_sf <- gb_get_cgaz(adm_lvl = "ADM0") %>%   inner_join(latam_meta,     by =       c("shapeGroup" = "boundaryISO")   )  ggplot(latam_sf) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = income_factor)) +   scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Greens", direction = -1) +   guides(fill = guide_legend(position = "bottom", nrow = 2)) +   coord_sf(     crs = "+proj=laea +lon_0=-75 +lat_0=-15"   ) +   labs(     title = "World Bank Income Group",     subtitle = "Latin America and the Caribbean",     fill = "",     caption = "Source: www.geoboundaries.org"   )

title: geobounds: Accessing Global Administrative Boundary Data in R
text: geobounds package makes easy fetch, manage visualize administrative boundary data worldwide reproducible efficient way. Whether ’re mapping, spatial analysis, survey integration geospatial modelling, gives high-quality boundary dataset minimal overhead.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement Diego H.. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributing to geobounds
text: outlines propose change geobounds. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to geobounds
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to geobounds
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to geobounds
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("dieghernan/geobounds", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to geobounds
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use Air apply style, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to geobounds
text: Please note geobounds project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

what: geobounds | R package for download geodata from geoBoundaries
title: geobounds | R package for download geodata from geoBoundaries
text: Attribution required using geoBoundaries.

title: geobounds | R package for download geodata from geoBoundaries
text: geobounds package provides R-friendly interface access work geoBoundaries dataset (open-license global database administrative boundary polygons). Using package, can: Programmatically retrieve administrative boundary geometries (e.g., country → region → district) geoBoundaries Use tidyverse / sf workflows R map, analyse join boundaries data Work open-data context (geoBoundaries uses CC -4.0) / open licences) short: work geospatial boundaries R (shape files, polygons, join data), package simplifies process.

title: geobounds | R package for download geodata from geoBoundaries
text: can install developing version geobounds : Alternatively, can install geobounds using r-universe:
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("dieghernan/geobounds") # Install geobounds in R: install.packages("geobounds",   repos = c(     "https://dieghernan.r-universe.dev",     "https://cloud.r-project.org"   ) )

title: geobounds | R package for download geodata from geoBoundaries
code: library(geobounds)  sri_lanka_adm1 <- gb_get_adm1("Sri Lanka") sri_lanka_adm2 <- gb_get_adm2("Sri Lanka") sri_lanka_adm3 <- gb_get_adm3("Sri Lanka")  library(sf) library(dplyr)  library(ggplot2)  ggplot(sri_lanka_adm3) +   geom_sf(fill = "#DFDFDF", color = "white") +   geom_sf(data = sri_lanka_adm2, fill = NA, color = "#F0B323") +   geom_sf(data = sri_lanka_adm1, fill = NA, color = "black") +   labs(caption = "Source: www.geoboundaries.org") +   theme_void()

what: Clear your geobounds cache dir — gb_clear_cache
title: Clear your geobounds cache dir — gb_clear_cache
text: Use function caution. function clear cached data configuration, specifically: Deletes geobounds config directory (tools::R_user_dir("geobounds", "config")). Deletes cache_dir directory. Deletes values stored Sys.getenv("GEOBOUNDS_CACHE_DIR").

title: Clear your geobounds cache dir — gb_clear_cache
code: gb_clear_cache(config = FALSE, cached_data = TRUE, quiet = TRUE)

title: Clear your geobounds cache dir — gb_clear_cache
text: config Logical. TRUE, delete configuration folder geobounds. cached_data Logical. TRUE, delete cache_dir content. quiet logical. TRUE suppresses informational messages.

title: Clear your geobounds cache dir — gb_clear_cache
text: Invisible. function called side effects.

title: Clear your geobounds cache dir — gb_clear_cache
text: overkill function intended reset status never installed /used geobounds.

title: Clear your geobounds cache dir — gb_clear_cache
code: # Caution! This may modify your current state  # \dontrun{ my_cache <- gb_detect_cache_dir() #> ℹ C:\Users\RUNNER~1\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpyIFrOd/geobounds # Set an example cache ex <- file.path(tempdir(), "example", "cache") gb_set_cache_dir(ex, quiet = TRUE)  gb_clear_cache(quiet = FALSE) #> Error in gb_clear_cache(quiet = FALSE): could not find function "gb_clear_cache"  # Restore initial cache gb_set_cache_dir(my_cache) #> ✔ geobounds cache dir is C:\Users\RUNNER~1\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpyIFrOd/geobounds. #> ℹ To install your `cache_dir` path for use in future sessions run this function with `install = TRUE`. identical(my_cache, gb_detect_cache_dir()) #> ℹ C:\Users\RUNNER~1\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpyIFrOd/geobounds #> [1] TRUE # }

title: Detect cache dir for geobounds — gb_detect_cache_dir

what: Get individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get
title: Get individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get
text: Attribution required uses dataset. function returns data individual countries "represent ", special identification disputed areas. prefer data explicitly includes disputed areas, please use gb_get_cgaz().

title: Get individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get
code: gb_get(   country,   adm_lvl = "adm0",   simplified = FALSE,   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"),   quiet = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   cache_dir = NULL )

title: Get individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get
text: geoBoundaries API Service https://www.geoboundaries.org/api.html.

title: Get individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get
text: country character vector country codes. either "" (return data countries), vector country names ISO3 country codes. See also countrycode::countrycode(). adm_lvl Type boundary Accepted values "" (available boundaries) ADM level ("adm0" country boundary, "adm1" first level sub national boundaries, "adm2" second level . Upper case version ("ADM1") number level (1, 2, 3, 4, 5) also accepted. simplified logical. Return simplified boundary . default FALSE use premier geoBoundaries release. release_type One "gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative". users, suggest using "gbOpen" (default), CC-4.0 compliant can used purposes long attribution provided: "gbHumanitarian" files mirrored UN OCHA, may less open licensure. "gbAuthoritative" files mirrored UN SALB,  used commercial purposes, verified -country processes. quiet logical. TRUE suppresses informational messages. overwrite logical. set TRUE force fresh download source .zip file. cache_dir path cache directory. set (default NULL), data stored default cache directory (see gb_set_cache_dir()). cache directory set, files stored temporary directory (see base::tempdir()). See caching strategies gb_set_cache_dir().

title: Get individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get
text: sf object.

title: Get individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get
text: Individual data files geoBoundaries database governed license licenses identified within metadata respective boundary (see gb_get_metadata(). Users using individual boundary files geoBoundaries additionally ensure citing sources provided metadata file. See Examples. following wrappers also available: gb_get_adm0() returns country boundary. gb_get_adm1() returns first-level administration boundaries (e.g. States United States). gb_get_adm2() returns second-level administration boundaries (e.g. Counties United States). gb_get_adm3() returns third-level administration boundaries (e.g. towns cities countries). gb_get_adm4() returns fourth-level administration boundaries. gb_get_adm5() returns fifth-level administration boundaries.

title: Get individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get
text: Runfola, D. et al. (2020) geoBoundaries: global database political administrative boundaries. PLoS ONE 15(4): e0231866. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0231866 .

title: Get individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get
code: # \donttest{ # Map level 2 in Sri Lanka sri_lanka <- gb_get(   "Sri Lanka",   adm_lvl = 2,   simplified = TRUE )  sri_lanka #> Simple feature collection with 25 features and 5 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 79.65102 ymin: 5.919017 xmax: 81.87896 ymax: 9.835791 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # A tibble: 25 × 6 #>    shapeName     shapeISO shapeID shapeGroup shapeType                  geometry #>  * <chr>         <chr>    <chr>   <chr>      <chr>            <MULTIPOLYGON [°]> #>  1 Jaffna Distr… LK-41    463711… LKA        ADM2      (((79.7152 9.529465, 79.… #>  2 Kilinochchi … LK-42    463711… LKA        ADM2      (((80.01015 9.472403, 80… #>  3 Mannar Distr… LK-43    463711… LKA        ADM2      (((80.11535 9.209068, 80… #>  4 Mullaitivu D… LK-45    463711… LKA        ADM2      (((80.61353 9.456581, 80… #>  5 Vavuniya Dis… LK-44    463711… LKA        ADM2      (((80.23541 8.680412, 80… #>  6 Galle Distri… LK-31    463711… LKA        ADM2      (((79.98757 6.440352, 79… #>  7 Hambantota D… LK-33    463711… LKA        ADM2      (((80.67006 6.306029, 80… #>  8 Matara Distr… LK-32    463711… LKA        ADM2      (((80.3818 5.965264, 80.… #>  9 Ampara Distr… LK-52    463711… LKA        ADM2      (((81.70788 6.51073, 81.… #> 10 Anuradhapura… LK-71    463711… LKA        ADM2      (((80.03237 8.527211, 80… #> # ℹ 15 more rows  library(ggplot2) ggplot(sri_lanka) +   geom_sf() +   labs(caption = "Source: www.geoboundaries.org")  # }  # Metadata library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union gb_get_meta(   "Sri Lanka",   adm_lvl = 2 ) %>%   # Check individual license   select(boundaryISO, boundaryType, licenseDetail, licenseSource) %>%   glimpse() #> Rows: 1 #> Columns: 4 #> $ boundaryISO   <chr> "LKA" #> $ boundaryType  <chr> "ADM2" #> $ licenseDetail <chr> "Open Data Commons Open Database License 1.0" #> $ licenseSource <chr> "www.openstreetmap.org/copyright"

what: Get country files from geoBoundaries for a given administration level — gb_get_adm
title: Get country files from geoBoundaries for a given administration level — gb_get_adm
text: Attribution required uses dataset. functions wrappers gb_get() extracting given administration level: gb_get_adm0() returns country boundary. gb_get_adm1() returns first-level administration boundaries (e.g. States United States). gb_get_adm2() returns second-level administration boundaries (e.g. Counties United States). gb_get_adm3() returns third-level administration boundaries (e.g. towns cities countries). gb_get_adm4() returns fourth-level administration boundaries. gb_get_adm5() returns fifth-level administration boundaries. Note countries number levels. Check gb_get_max_adm_lvl.

title: Get country files from geoBoundaries for a given administration level — gb_get_adm
code: gb_get_adm0(   country,   simplified = FALSE,   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"),   quiet = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   cache_dir = NULL )  gb_get_adm1(   country,   simplified = FALSE,   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"),   quiet = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   cache_dir = NULL )  gb_get_adm2(   country,   simplified = FALSE,   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"),   quiet = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   cache_dir = NULL )  gb_get_adm3(   country,   simplified = FALSE,   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"),   quiet = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   cache_dir = NULL )  gb_get_adm4(   country,   simplified = FALSE,   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"),   quiet = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   cache_dir = NULL )  gb_get_adm5(   country,   simplified = FALSE,   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"),   quiet = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   cache_dir = NULL )

title: Get country files from geoBoundaries for a given administration level — gb_get_adm
text: country character vector country codes. either "" (return data countries), vector country names ISO3 country codes. See also countrycode::countrycode(). simplified logical. Return simplified boundary . default FALSE use premier geoBoundaries release. release_type One "gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative". users, suggest using "gbOpen" (default), CC-4.0 compliant can used purposes long attribution provided: "gbHumanitarian" files mirrored UN OCHA, may less open licensure. "gbAuthoritative" files mirrored UN SALB,  used commercial purposes, verified -country processes. quiet logical. TRUE suppresses informational messages. overwrite logical. set TRUE force fresh download source .zip file. cache_dir path cache directory. set (default NULL), data stored default cache directory (see gb_set_cache_dir()). cache directory set, files stored temporary directory (see base::tempdir()). See caching strategies gb_set_cache_dir().

title: Get country files from geoBoundaries for a given administration level — gb_get_adm
text: sf object.

title: Get country files from geoBoundaries for a given administration level — gb_get_adm
text: Individual data files geoBoundaries database governed license licenses identified within metadata respective boundary (see gb_get_metadata(). Users using individual boundary files geoBoundaries additionally ensure citing sources provided metadata file.

title: Get country files from geoBoundaries for a given administration level — gb_get_adm
code: # \donttest{ lev2 <- gb_get_adm2(   c("Italia", "Suiza", "Austria"),   simplified = TRUE )   library(ggplot2)  ggplot(lev2) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = shapeGroup)) +   labs(     title = "Second-level administration",     subtitle = "Selected countries",     caption = "Source: www.geoboundaries.org"   )  # }

title: Get global composites data (CGAZ) from geoBoundaries — gb_get_cgaz
text: Attribution required uses dataset. function returns global composite required administration level, clipped international boundaries, gaps filled borders.

title: Get global composites data (CGAZ) from geoBoundaries — gb_get_cgaz
code: gb_get_cgaz(   country = "all",   adm_lvl = "adm0",   quiet = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   cache_dir = NULL )

title: Get global composites data (CGAZ) from geoBoundaries — gb_get_cgaz
text: country character vector country codes. either "" (return data countries), vector country names ISO3 country codes. See also countrycode::countrycode(). adm_lvl Type boundary Accepted values administrative levels 0, 1 2 ("adm0" country boundary, "adm1" first level sub national boundaries, "adm2" second level . Upper case version ("ADM1") number level (0, 1, 2) also accepted. quiet logical. TRUE suppresses informational messages. overwrite logical. set TRUE force fresh download source .zip file. cache_dir path cache directory. set (default NULL), data stored default cache directory (see gb_set_cache_dir()). cache directory set, files stored temporary directory (see base::tempdir()). See caching strategies gb_set_cache_dir().

title: Get global composites data (CGAZ) from geoBoundaries — gb_get_cgaz
text: sf object.

title: Get global composites data (CGAZ) from geoBoundaries — gb_get_cgaz
text: Comprehensive Global Administrative Zones (CGAZ) set global composites administrative boundaries. two important distinctions global product individual country downloads. Extensive simplification performed ensure file sizes small enough used traditional desktop software. Disputed areas removed replaced polygons following US Department State definitions.

title: Get global composites data (CGAZ) from geoBoundaries — gb_get_cgaz
code: # This download may take some time # \dontrun{ world <- gb_get_cgaz()  library(ggplot2)  ggplot(world) +   geom_sf() +   coord_sf(expand = FALSE) +   labs(caption = "Source: www.geoboundaries.org")  # }

See also countrycode::countrycode(). release_type One "gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative". users, suggest using "gbOpen" (default), CC-4.0 compliant can used purposes long attribution provided: "gbHumanitarian" files mirrored UN OCHA, may less open licensure. "gbAuthoritative" files mirrored UN SALB,  used commercial purposes, verified -country processes.

title: Get the highest administrative level available for a given country — gb_get_max_adm_lvl
code: all <- gb_get_max_adm_lvl() library(dplyr)  # Countries with only 1 level available all %>%   filter(maxBoundaryType == 1) #> # A tibble: 21 × 2 #>    boundaryISO maxBoundaryType #>    <chr>                 <int> #>  1 AND                       1 #>  2 ARE                       1 #>  3 ATG                       1 #>  4 BHR                       1 #>  5 BRB                       1 #>  6 DMA                       1 #>  7 GRD                       1 #>  8 GRL                       1 #>  9 KNA                       1 #> 10 LBY                       1 #> # ℹ 11 more rows  # Countries with level 4 available all %>%   filter(maxBoundaryType == 4) #> # A tibble: 18 × 2 #>    boundaryISO maxBoundaryType #>    <chr>                 <int> #>  1 AUT                       4 #>  2 BEL                       4 #>  3 BGD                       4 #>  4 CZE                       4 #>  5 FJI                       4 #>  6 GLP                       4 #>  7 IRN                       4 #>  8 ITA                       4 #>  9 LKA                       4 #> 10 MDG                       4 #> 11 MTQ                       4 #> 12 MYT                       4 #> 13 REU                       4 #> 14 SLB                       4 #> 15 SLE                       4 #> 16 SVK                       4 #> 17 UGA                       4 #> 18 ZAF                       4

what: Get metadata of individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get_meta
title: Get metadata of individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get_meta
text: function returns metadata geoBoundaries API.

title: Get metadata of individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get_meta
code: gb_get_meta(   country = "all",   adm_lvl = "all",   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative") )

title: Get metadata of individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get_meta
text: country character vector country codes. either "" (return data countries), vector country names ISO3 country codes. See also countrycode::countrycode(). adm_lvl Type boundary Accepted values "" (available boundaries) ADM level ("adm0" country boundary, "adm1" first level sub national boundaries, "adm2" second level . Upper case version ("ADM1") number level (1, 2, 3, 4, 5) also accepted. release_type One "gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative". users, suggest using "gbOpen" (default), CC-4.0 compliant can used purposes long attribution provided: "gbHumanitarian" files mirrored UN OCHA, may less open licensure. "gbAuthoritative" files mirrored UN SALB,  used commercial purposes, verified -country processes.

title: Get metadata of individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get_meta
text: tibble class tbl_df.

title: Get metadata of individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get_meta
text: result tibble following columns: boundaryID: ID layer, combination ISO code, boundary type, unique identifier boundary generated based input metadata geometry. changes underlying data changes. boundaryName: name country layer represents. boundaryISO: ISO-3166-1 (Alpha 3) code country. boundaryYearRepresented: year, range years "START END" format, boundary layers represent. boundaryType: type boundary. boundaryCanonical: canonical name given boundary. boundarySource: comma-separated list primary sources boundary. boundarySource: comma-separated list primary sources boundary. boundaryLicense: original license dataset released primary source. licenseDetail: notes regarding license. licenseSource: URL primary source. sourceDataUpdateDate: date source information integrated geoBoundaries repository. buildDate: date source data recently standardized built geoBoundaries release. Continent: continent country associated . UNSDG-region: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) region country associated . UNSDG-subregion: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) subregion country associated . worldBankIncomeGroup: World Bank income group country associated . admUnitCount: Count administrative units file. meanVertices: Mean number vertices defining boundaries administrative unit layer. minVertices: Minimum number vertices defining boundary. maxVertices: Maximum number vertices defining boundary. minPerimeterLengthKM: minimum perimeter length administrative unit layer, measured kilometers (based World Equidistant Cylindrical projection). meanPerimeterLengthKM: mean perimeter length administrative unit layer, measured kilometers (based World Equidistant Cylindrical projection). maxPerimeterLengthKM: maximum perimeter length administrative unit layer, measured kilometers (based World Equidistant Cylindrical projection). meanAreaSqKM: mean area administrative units layer, measured square kilometers (based EASE-GRID 2 projection). minAreaSqKM: minimum area administrative unit layer, measured square kilometers (based EASE-GRID 2 projection). maxAreaSqKM: maximum area administrative unit layer, measured square kilometers (based EASE-GRID 2 projection). staticDownloadLink: static download link aggregate zip file containing boundary information. gjDownloadURL: static download link geoJSON. tjDownloadURL: static download link topoJSON. imagePreview: static download link automatically rendered PNG layer. simplifiedGeometryGeoJSON: static download link simplified geoJSON.

title: Get metadata of individual country files from geoBoundaries — gb_get_meta
code: # Get metadata of ADM4 levels  library(dplyr)  gb_get_meta(adm_lvl = "ADM4") %>%   glimpse() #> Rows: 21 #> Columns: 32 #> $ boundaryID                <chr> "AUT-ADM4-71187352", "BEL-ADM4-45533444", "B… #> $ boundaryName              <chr> "Austria", "Belgium", "Bangladesh", "Czechia… #> $ boundaryISO               <chr> "AUT", "BEL", "BGD", "CZE", "FJI", "FRA", "G… #> $ boundaryYearRepresented   <chr> "2017", "2018", "2020", "2017", "2007", "201… #> $ boundaryType              <chr> "ADM4", "ADM4", "ADM4", "ADM4", "ADM4", "ADM… #> $ boundaryCanonical         <chr> "Unknown", "Unknown", "Union Councils / Muni… #> $ boundarySource            <chr> "Federal Office for Metrology and Survey, Au… #> $ boundaryLicense           <chr> "Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 2.0… #> $ licenseDetail             <chr> NA, "Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 Intern… #> $ licenseSource             <chr> "twitter.com/WMgeoLab/status/125348789431395… #> $ boundarySourceURL         <chr> "www.bev.gv.at/portal/page?_pageid=713,26393… #> $ sourceDataUpdateDate      <dttm> 2023-01-19 07:31:04, 2023-07-10 13:37:13, 2… #> $ buildDate                 <date> 2023-12-12, 2023-12-12, 2023-12-12, 2023-12… #> $ Continent                 <chr> "Europe", "Europe", "Asia", "Europe", "Ocean… #> $ `UNSDG-region`            <chr> "Europe and Northern America", "Europe and N… #> $ `UNSDG-subregion`         <chr> "Western Europe", "Western Europe", "Souther… #> $ worldBankIncomeGroup      <chr> "High-income Countries", "High-income Countr… #> $ admUnitCount 53, 632, 11, 4, 38, 31, 4,… #> $ maxVertices               <dbl> 52740, 1084, 9182, 4028, 847, 15387, 10383, … #> $ meanPerimeterLengthKM     <dbl> 20.856955, 45.147426, 33.020823, 17.697541, … #> $ minPerimeterLengthKM      <dbl> 0.5618598, 6.5279918, 1.3478627, 0.3701208, … #> $ maxPerimeterLengthKM      <dbl> 152.20420, 115.80431, 1004.40607, 80.51895, … #> $ meanAreaSqKM              <dbl> 10.693872, 52.056224, 27.103105, 6.025353, 1… #> $ minAreaSqKM               <dbl> 0.004377737, 1.156515012, 0.026838648, 0.002… #> $ maxAreaSqKM               <dbl> 467.16996, 215.52080, 1230.96466, 87.32215, … #> $ staticDownloadLink        <chr> "https://github.com/wmgeolab/geoBoundaries/r… #> $ gjDownloadURL             <chr> "https://github.com/wmgeolab/geoBoundaries/r… #> $ tjDownloadURL what: Set your geobounds cache dir — gb_set_cache_dir
title: Set your geobounds cache dir — gb_set_cache_dir
text: function store cache_dir path local machine load future sessions. Type gb_detect_cache_dir() find cached path.

title: Set your geobounds cache dir — gb_set_cache_dir
code: gb_set_cache_dir(cache_dir, overwrite = FALSE, install = FALSE, quiet = FALSE)

title: Set your geobounds cache dir — gb_set_cache_dir
text: cache_dir path cache directory. missing value function store cached files temporary dir (See base::tempdir()). overwrite Logical. set TRUE, overwrite existing cache_dir. install Logical. TRUE, install key local machine use future sessions.  Defaults FALSE. cache_dir FALSE parameter set FALSE automatically. quiet logical. TRUE suppresses informational messages.

title: Set your geobounds cache dir — gb_set_cache_dir
text: (invisible) character path cache_dir.

title: Set your geobounds cache dir — gb_set_cache_dir
text: default, cache cache_dir set package uses folder inside base::tempdir() (files temporary removed R session ends). persist cache across R sessions, use gb_set_cache(path, install = TRUE) writes chosen path small configuration file tools::R_user_dir("geobounds", "config").

title: Set your geobounds cache dir — gb_set_cache_dir
text: occasional use, rely default tempdir()-based cache (install). Modify cache single session setting gb_set_cache_dir(cache_dir = "/path/). reproducible workflows, install persistent cache gb_set_cache_dir(cache_dir = "/path/, install = TRUE) kept across R sessions. caching specific files, use cache_dir argument corresponding function. See gb_get().

title: Set your geobounds cache dir — gb_set_cache_dir
code: # Caution! This may modify your current state  # \dontrun{ my_cache <- gb_detect_cache_dir() #> ℹ C:\Users\RUNNER~1\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpyIFrOd/geobounds  # Set an example cache ex <- file.path(tempdir(), "example", "cachenew") gb_set_cache_dir(ex) #> ✔ geobounds cache dir is C:\Users\RUNNER~1\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpyIFrOd/example/cachenew. #> ℹ To install your `cache_dir` path for use in future sessions run this function with `install = TRUE`.  gb_detect_cache_dir() #> ℹ C:\Users\RUNNER~1\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpyIFrOd/example/cachenew #> [1] "C:\\Users\\RUNNER~1\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\RtmpyIFrOd/example/cachenew"  # Restore initial cache gb_set_cache_dir(my_cache) #> ✔ geobounds cache dir is C:\Users\RUNNER~1\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpyIFrOd/geobounds. #> ℹ To install your `cache_dir` path for use in future sessions run this function with `install = TRUE`. identical(my_cache, gb_detect_cache_dir()) #> ℹ C:\Users\RUNNER~1\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpyIFrOd/geobounds #> [1] TRUE # }  gb_detect_cache_dir() #> ℹ C:\Users\RUNNER~1\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpyIFrOd/geobounds #> [1] "C:\\Users\\RUNNER~1\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\RtmpyIFrOd/geobounds"

what: geobounds: Download Map Data from 'geoBoundaries' — geobounds-package
title: geobounds: Download Map Data from 'geoBoundaries' — geobounds-package
text: Tools download data 'geoBoundaries' https://www.geoboundaries.org/. Several administration levels available. See Runfola, D. et al. (2020) geoBoundaries: global database political administrative boundaries. PLoS ONE 15(4): e0231866. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0231866 .

title: geobounds: Download Map Data from 'geoBoundaries' — geobounds-package
text: Maintainer: Diego Hernangómez diego.hernangomezherrero@gmail.com (ORCID) [copyright holder] contributors: William Mary geoLab [copyright holder]

title: geobounds (development version)
text: Functions downloading data renamed follow convention object_verb() (see https://devguide.ropensci.org/pkg_building.html): get_gb() -> gb_get(). get_gb_adm family -> gb_get_adm. get_gb_cgaz() -> gb_get_cgaz(). get_gb_meta() -> gb_get_meta() (alias gb_get_metadata()). Additionally, metadata argument removed. Use gb_get_meta() instead.

title: geobounds (development version)
text: gb_get_adm5() added. gb_get_max_adm_lvl() added.  Source files: Use .zip/.shp version dataset instead .geojson/.gpkg. implies geojsonsf dependency Imports removed needed . consequence cached files previous versions package used . Improve detection Antarctica Kosovo. functions return MULTIPOLYGON. Function fails gracefully country file available (neither errors warnings). httr2::req_retry() implemented avoid timeout / transient errors. gb_get*(): functions now country argument recognize mixed types (e.g. gb_get(country = c("Germany", "USA")) work). gb_get_cgaz() get latest data available repo https://github.com/wmgeolab/geoBoundaries/tree/main/releaseData. Add DOI.

title: geobounds 0.0.1
text: Initial release.
